title: Pair of former Red Sox saves Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single, leading the Dodgers to a 3-1 win over the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez made a critical outfield play, throwing out a baserunner to secure the Dodgers' victory and force Game 7.
The Dodgers' win keeps their hopes of repeating as World Series champions alive, with the final game against Toronto upcoming.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff celebrated Halloween by dressing up and handing out candy on the T, featuring popular characters like Wizard of Oz.
Boston Police reported a SpongeBob SquarePants costume at Eastie's trick-or-treat event organized by the Salesians Boys & Girls Club.
Boston Medical Center dressed NICU babies in handmade costumes, including superheroes and Celtics champions, for Halloween festivities.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An unclaimed $50,000 Powerball ticket sold at New Capital Farms in Marlborough is about to expire on November 20.
The winning ticket from November 20, 2024, matched four numbers and the Powerball with numbers 16-30-60-62-64 and Powerball 25.
If unclaimed, the prize money will be distributed across Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns, per lottery officials.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia held a Halloween wedding at Salem's Willows Park.
The couple wore thematic attire, with Danielle in a black dress and veil, for their dream wedding.
Their wedding ceremony was documented by Jay Willet of WBZ for radio and television coverage.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points in their tight 109-108 victory over the 76ers.
The Celtics struggled to maintain pace, allowing a 32-8 run by the 76ers, but held on for their third straight win.
Anfernee Simons showed mixed results with increased aggression, finishing as a team-high +23 as the Celtics built their lead.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash after wearing a bloodied Jackie Kennedy costume, claiming it's a statement, not a mere costume.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's Halloween outfit, labeling it 'disgusting, desperate and dangerous' on social media.
Fox defended her outfit, stating it symbolizes Jackie Kennedy's trauma, power, and femininity as resistance after JFK's assassination.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London to play against Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Penix and London's return comes as Atlanta seeks to end a two-game losing streak against a 6-2 Patriots team.
Drake London ranked sixth among NFL WRs by PFF, set to challenge Patriots CB Christian Gonzalez in Week 9 matchup.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire key players after making the 2025 playoffs.
The Red Sox face potential roster changes as Alex Bregman may opt out, creating a third-base vacancy.
With a strong farm system and $25 million under luxury tax, the Red Sox have resources for offseason improvements.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots coach, insists recent changes aren't attempts to escape the team's successful past.
Vrabel altered pregame intros, individualizing players, marking a departure from a 24-year-old tradition.
The Patriots are 6-2 under Vrabel, leading AFC East, though some changes have faced logistical challenges.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained during a game against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov will assume the first-line center position, skating with David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm's absence affects Boston's power play, where he has scored four of his nine points this season.
